column176: 1) Please describe your level of vision.

column4: Recent research is trying to figure out how to make images accessible.
column10: Describe the texture of the ground. describe a larger area of the landscape.
column11: It was not particularly good at all.
column12: It was a bare bones description, and did not provide context for the article apart from indicating that there was a path present.
column19: Provide a more detailed description of the image. What do the trees look like? Can you describe the banks of the lake, what is on the mountains, etc?
column20: I could tell that it was relevant to the article.
column28: Describe the texture of the roof, and provide more detail about the spires; texture, estimated height/diameter, and placement.
column30: There could have been more detail.
column37: What are the textures of the walls, floor, and ceiling? Describe any period decoration styles.
column38: It was concise, and sounded relevant to the article.
column39: Finer detail was lacking, considering that it was an article on interior design, which is likely reliant on subtle and complex interior design conditions in regards to the types of furniture and other decorations placed in the room.
column46: Describe in more detail the utensils being used.
column47: It was the most detailed description I have seen so far.
column48: It did not highlight the equipment being used, which would have been more relevant to in the context of the article.
column55: How is this relevant to the article?
column73: For once, I have no questions.
column74: It was concise yet provided enough detail to be useful.
column82: CanAre the ads visible enough to describe?
column91: Does the cathedral have any features resembling a cross in its architecture?
column92: It was thorough enough to allow me to imagine myself there.
column100: Can the roof be seen well enough for its material to be described?
column101: The building material of the church was identified.
column102: The graveyard description did not seem to be relevant to the article.
column109: Describe the guitars in more detail.
column111: poorly written all around; lacking in detail
column118: Why did you not describe the hair styles of the people in the image?
column120: It was irrelevant to the article.
column121: Was this really the image in the wikipedia article?
column136: Is there anything else on the table?
column138: The sentence structure of the description sounded awkward, and I wonder if details were left out.
column145: I cannot think of any further questions.
column155: It provided interesting details about what was going on in the image.
column172: The description answered all of my questions.
column173: The description was concise yet provided enough detail so as to be relevant to the article.
column177: Always (More than 95% of the time you use computers)
column183: If you're going to write a question asking if the description provided too much information, then you should also be measuring feedback from people saying that the descriptions did not provide enough information. I wonder if there was some underlying bias when that question was designed and implemented.
